q: staff to search children for any material that may disrupt lessons feature in the Bill, while rules forcing schools to give parents 24 hours notice of a detention will also be scrapped. Mr Michael Gove said: This Government backs teachers. All the evidence from those countries with great education systems tells us that nothing is more important than attracting great people into teaching and supporting them in the classroom. "Teachers will be free to impose the penalties they need to keep order and free from the red tape which swallows up teaching time, so they can get on with their first duty- raising standards. Plans to axe a number of education quangos will feature in the bill, as will the legislation required to allow Government to charge university students higher rates of interest on tuition fee loans. CAMERON I am very sorry that Andy Coulson has decided to resign as my Director of Communications, although I understand that the continuing pressures on him and his family mean that he feels compelled to do so. Andy Coulson has told me that the focus on him was impeding his ability to do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the Government. "During his time working for me, Andy Coulson has carried out his role with complete professionalism. He has been a brilliant member of my team and has thrown himself at the job with skill and dedication
